Professional Profile

As an IT professional with a background in Information Technology from Ghana Communication Technology University, I specialize in bridging the gap between technical innovation and regulatory compliance. My experience spans spectrum monitoring, ICT regulation, and AI governance, with a focus on developing frameworks that ensure responsible technology adoption.

At the National Communications Authority, I contributed to regulatory enforcement and compliance monitoring, gaining valuable insights into telecommunications policy and spectrum management. This experience, combined with my technical expertise, positions me to address complex challenges at the intersection of technology, policy, and social impact.

Beyond my professional work, I serve as Assistant Finance Secretary for the BHOBU 2020 Year Group and founded the Highest Love Charity Initiative, demonstrating my commitment to community development and sustainable growth aligned with UN SDGs 1 (No Poverty) and 4 (Quality Education).

National Service Person

National Communications Authority | Head Office

Oct 2024 - Aug 2025

During my national service at the National Communications Authority, I contributed to regulatory enforcement for FM and TV broadcasting operations across Greater Accra, Eastern, and Central Regions. My responsibilities included:

  • Collaborating with engineers to enhance monitoring processes and procedures
  • Assisting in license management and renewals for broadcasting stations
  • Conducting technical signal measurements using Audimat analyzer to ensure compliance with broadcasting standards
  • Supporting spectrum monitoring activities and reporting
  • Participating in regulatory compliance inspections and assessments

This experience provided me with valuable insights into telecommunications regulation and spectrum management, strengthening my understanding of ICT policy frameworks.
